thread.title: Donny Osmond duets with 11-year-old hearing impaired fan in very emotional moment
thread.title_full: Donny Osmond duets with 11-year-old hearing impaired fan in very emotional moment

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Donny Osmond duets with 11-year-old hearing impaired fan in very emotional moment
text:
An 11-year-old boy captured Donny Osmond’s heart after he was invited on stage to sing with his idol. 
Hearing impaired Matthew English duetted on ‘Any Dream Will Do’ when the star heard he had been a fan since the age of three and wanted to raise awareness of hearing loss. 
Matthew from Orpington, Kent, wore Donny’s famous Technicolour Dreamcoat from musical Joseph for the gig in front of packed audiences in Brighton. Donny performing with 11-year-old fan Matthew English (Photo: Facebook/Donny Osmond) 
The emotional duet was welcomed by the crowds who gave Matthew a standing ovation. 
Uploading a video of the impromptu sing a-long to Facebook later Donny, 59, said: “This video was taken during the purple card improv segment of the show last night in Brighton. He has been a fan since the age of three (Photo: Facebook/Donny Osmond) 
“It was one of the coolest moments ever when 11-year-old Matthew English joined me on stage to sing ‘Any Dream Will Do.’ He’s been singing it ever since he was about 5 and plays the violin to it as well. He reminds me of my grandson Dylan. This was pretty special.” 
The video has already been viewed 625,000 times with many people leaving messages of support. The hearing impaired fan performed with his hero (Photo: Facebook/Donny Osmond) 
Once concert goer wrote: “I was at Brighton last night and although this video is great, you can’t get the full impact and the emotion involved.” 
Matthew, who has just one ear and no ear canal, said it was an “amazing experience.” 
His mother Janice added: “He hopes he story will be inspirational to other children with similar conditions to be confident and follows their dreams!” Like us on Facebook
